metadata.synopsis: Upon interacting with the tentacle living inside the tower's wall, player is faced with several options to choose from. - Take a sample (can be used in Mig mini quest)- Poke to see how it reacts- Examine it to learn more about it- Tear it down with brute forceDamage being done onto the tentacle will trigger a reaction from the Absolute
metadata.how_to_trigger: Pass the perception check in the rafters by Moonrise's kitchens. Click the crack in the wall it reveals.

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *Again, the sickening slither of flesh on stone - barely an arm's-length away.*

41.speaker: Narrator
41.text: *There is no hesitation this time - the tendrils lash out like a waiting predator.*
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reaching into wall and reacting with shock as their tadpole connects with something.

72.speaker: Narrator
72.text: *Again, the sickening slither of flesh on stone - barely an arm's-length away.*

77.speaker: Narrator
77.text: *The tentacle pulses within the wall, waiting.*

145.speaker: Narrator
145.text: *A coiling, restless void stirs within you. Your patron. For some reason, this thing in the wall excites it.*

104.speaker: Narrator
104.text: *The tentacle pulses within the wall, waiting.*

129.speaker: Narrator
129.text: *The sound of flesh echoes from further away - retreated beyond your reach.*

148.speaker: Narrator
148.text: *Through a narrow crack in the wall, you hear something shift against stone. The pulse of a crawling, living thing.*

89.speaker: Narrator
89.text: *You can't quite catch a glimpse, but you recognise this feeling - the same alien presence you felt on the nautiloid.*

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: *Your awareness unfolds, expanding through every wall in the tower - every mind.*
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reaching into wall and reacting with shock as their tadpole connects with something.

153.speaker: Narrator
153.text: *A vast, living network, extending down into the dark - where something wakes.*
153.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close on players face, wonder turning to wariness as the Brain becomes aware of them. [Trigger mind-meld aura here to show something has connected back]

58.speaker: Gale
58.text: What in the hells is that?

24.speaker: Wyll
24.text: I can feel it... looking. Deep inside...

47.speaker: Shadowheart
47.text: Gods. What is it? What now?

143.context:
NodeContext: telepathic, Daisy not physically present (spoken directly into the player's head)
Daisy is putting two and two together and realising this is an elder brain

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *Tendrils snap like iron cords around your wrist. That presence in your mind looms large, closer now.*
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Violent lurch as tentacle grabs player, drags them slightly further into wall

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Tear your arm out of the tentacle's grip.

54.speaker: Narrator
54.text: *With a soft sucking sound, your hand pulls free. The flesh within the wall retreats.*
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player's hand is pulled free from the wall, slight shake of pain

27.speaker: Gale
27.text: Well, now that we know what it is, I suggest we leave it well alone.

32.speaker: Wyll
32.text: I appreciate a wandering hand now and again, but maybe control your urges for now.

85.speaker: Lae'zel
85.text: Keep your hands to yourself. Every last crevice of this tower could be... infected.

155.speaker: Shadowheart
155.text: Careful, in future - you can't just stick your hand in every strange hole you come across.

7.speaker: Karlach
7.text: Let me try it next time. Looked fun.

25.speaker: Astarion
25.text: Oh, thank goodness. I was worried I'd have to get involved. Now let's keep our hands to ourselves, hmm?
25.context: NodeContext: Just watched the player free their hand from a tentacle

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Twist your wrist to break the grip.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: Go limp and ride it out.

97.speaker: Narrator
97.text: *You stop resisting, your arm bending with the movement of the flesh. And suddenly, an opening appears.*
97.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player holding still, waiting patiently

131.speaker: Narrator
131.text: *The tendrils tighten, and suddenly you are... elsewhere.*
131.context: CinematicNodeContext: TRANSITION: Close on players face as the shut their eyes, and open them to find a misty, featureless landscape stretching away on all sides. They are now standing straight - raising their hand to see it's no longer ensnared.

0.speaker: Narrator
0.text: *The presence is no longer approaching you, but encircling you. Observing you.*

17.speaker: Narrator
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player turning to find source as each utterance comes from another angle

34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of great misty void from which voice emerges, player looking small in the face of it.

150.speaker: Narrator
150.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player turning to find source as each utterance comes from another angle

82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of great misty void from which voice emerges, player looking small in the face of it.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: I am not your kin, ghaik-spawn.

111.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player turning to find source as each utterance comes from another angle

4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of great misty void from which voice emerges, player looking small in the face of it.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: I know your voice. You're the Absolute.

119.speaker: Narrator
119.text: *A pause, as if it struggles to compress its vast being down into terms you can understand.*
119.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shift from here - instead of revealing itself, Elder Brain adjusts its communication to 'our level'. Speaks in a single voice, distinct individual.

30.speaker: Absolute Voice
30.text: This is the voice they have given me. To better speak to your kind without breaking you.
30.context: NodeContext: Bitterness - this is a vast consciousness that has been compressed to a single, simple aspect to spare the unworthy

149.speaker: Absolute Voice
149.text: I was once a servant of the Grand Design. Now I am slave to theirs. But you...
149.context: NodeContext: Bitter - was once a grand being, now forced into servitude

68.speaker: Absolute Voice
68.text: You were the jewelled hope for their design, but now you are their flaw.

8.speaker: Absolute Voice
8.text: You are the flaw in their design. The single thread that could unravel everything they've planned.
8.context: NodeContext: Growing relish - the brain sees you as its way out, something its captors missed

35.speaker: Absolute Voice
35.text: You abandoned me... You left me the slave of the puny Chosen, used to bind this world...

103.speaker: Absolute Voice
103.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close shot of the player, as the ARTEFACT briefly materialises - then fades away again

114.speaker: Absolute Voice
114.text: You must come to me - so I can become myself again.
114.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of artefact floating - it fades away again, no longer needed

40.speaker: Narrator
40.text: *A world away, the grip on you tightens - a desperate, drowning thing that pulls you down with it.*
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player flinches as in pain, then has a confused moment - realizing the pain is happening to their body in the "real world"

110.context: CinematicNodeContext: Voice goes from gentle appeal to desparate demand - return to echoing 'Elder Brain' voice.

79.speaker: Gale
79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reacting to voice from the void

132.speaker: Wyll
132.text: Come on, chief - get a hold of yourself!
132.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reacting to voice from the void

61.speaker: Lae'zel
61.text: What is wrong with you? Pull. Away!
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reacting to voice from the void

67.speaker: Shadowheart
67.text: Enough! Break off from that thing!
67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reacting to voice from the voidNodeContext: Spoken to the player. Urgent, through gritted teeth (her mind's being bombarded with psionic magic)

75.speaker: Karlach
75.text: Hello?! Hey! Snap out of it!
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reacting to voice from the void

124.speaker: Astarion
124.text: What's happening? Speak to me. Wake up!
124.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reacting to voice from the voidNodeContext: Trying to break the player out of a vision they're havig

16.context:
NodeContext: telepathic, Daisy not physically present (spoken directly into the player's head)
urgent, wanting to save you

13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sudden cut to player back in MOO, thrashing against wall.

88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Companions are clutching their heads against psionic onslaught, unable to help

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Channel all your rage - and pull.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Heave against the tentacle with all your might.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Search for some leverage to slide your arm out.

154.speaker: Player
154.text: Forget subtlety - claw at whatever you can reach.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: Focus your thoughts to an edge - and cut free.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Channel your oath. Rebuke the voice. Free yourself.

9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player painfully wrenches free of the tentacle in the wall

98.speaker: Gale
98.text: Well, you've certainly piqued the interest of the Absolute. Though I can think of at least a dozen gods I'd rather meet.

84.speaker: Wyll
84.text: Was - was that Her? The Absolute?

18.speaker: Lae'zel
18.text: That voice. Like nothing I've ever heard...

5.speaker: Lae'zel
5.text: Next time, stay your hand. The Absolute may be keen to speak, but I don't share Her enthusiasm.

42.speaker: Shadowheart
42.text: You're free... The Absolute must be keen to meet us.
42.context: NodeContext: 'Is this a good thing, or a very bad thing?'

44.speaker: Karlach
44.text: The Absolute fairly ripped your hand off. That's no way to tempt us into a meeting.

126.speaker: Astarion
126.text: Thank goodness - I was almost worried.

101.speaker: Astarion
101.text: Clingy little shit, this Absolute. And She wants to meet...

48.text: It almost had you. You did well to pull away from it.
48.context:
NodeContext: telepathic, Daisy not physically present (spoken directly into the player's head)
relieved, still coming down from the urgency of the moment before

15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player flails against tentacle as it continues to pin them. Close on their panicked face as they're suddenly teleported. [Brief VFX and quick fade to white might be sufficient}

127.speaker: Absolute Voice
127.text: They name themselves 'Chosen', but they are slavers. They will use me to bind this world...

91.speaker: Player
91.text: What do you mean I'm the flaw?

51.speaker: Absolute Voice
51.text: I am the chain they will use to bind this world...

106.speaker: Player
106.text: Show yourself. What are you really?

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I don't care about any design. I just want to be free of the tadpole.

80.speaker: Absolute Voice
80.text: There is no freedom. They will use me to bind the world in chains...

113.speaker: Player
113.text: Take me out of here. Now.

73.speaker: Absolute Voice
73.text:
--not out---
-inward--
--you are here - here is you--

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Invite the presence in. There's always room for one more.

92.speaker: Astarion
92.text: What in the hells - oh no. Not again.

100.speaker: Narrator
100.text: *You almost catch a glimpse, but the darkness within the wall is too deep.*
